intro: Dubouzetia australiensis, commonly known as the Australian sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It has a low-growing habit and produces small, rounded fruits that are dispersed by wind. Dubouzetia australiensis is well adapted to harsh environmental conditions and plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils.
